title: Salesforce investors hope for faster growth, AI progress in earnings

title: China's open-source AI models narrow gap with global proprietary rivals
description: CHINA’S open-source artificial intelligence (AI) models, such as Alibaba Cloud’s Qwen and DeepSeek, are rapidly narrowing the performance gap with top global proprietary models, as open-source models become a major growth engine in the enterprise large-language model market, the Xinhua News Agency said on Monday, citing a market survey.

title: Anthropic Completes New Funding Round at $183 Billion Valuation
description: Anthropic has closed a deal to raise $13 billion from investors in a new funding round that nearly triples its valuation to $183 billion, including dollars raised — a larger-than-expected haul that makes the artificial intelligence company one of the most valuable startups in the world.

title: ChatGPT to get parental controls after teen's death
description: American artificial intelligence firm OpenAI said Tuesday it would add parental controls to its chatbot ChatGPT.
content:
PARIS — American artificial intelligence firm OpenAI said Tuesday it would add parental controls to its chatbot ChatGPT, a week after an American couple said the system encouraged their teenaged son to kill himself.

title: OpenAI and Meta Say They're Fixing AI Chatbots to Better Respond to Teens in Distress
description: SAN FRANCISCO (AP) — Artificial intelligence chatbot makers OpenAI and Meta say they are adjusting how their chatbots respond to teenagers and other users asking questions about suicide or showing signs of mental and emotional distress.
content:

title: AI Chugs a Bottle of Water Every Time You Chat With It
description: Artificial intelligence systems are thirsty, consuming as much as 500 milliliters of water – a single-serving water bottle – for each short conversation a user has with the GPT-3 version of OpenAI's ChatGPT system.

title: US manufacturing mired in weakness; AI spending boom helps some factories
description: U.S. manufacturing contracted for the sixth consecutive month in August, impacted by import tariffs, according to the Institute for Supply Management. However, increased spending on artificial intelligence is providing some support to specific industry segments. While new orders increased, production declined, and factory employment remained subdued, with suppliers experiencing slower delivery times and elevated input prices.
